title: Talking About Your Work or Studies

content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to talk about your job or studies. This is a very common topic when meeting new people.
Use 'Ik ben...' for your profession (e.g., 'Ik ben programmeur') and 'Ik studeer...' for your field of study (e.g., 'Ik studeer geschiedenis').

data.tip: The 'g' sound is soft, made in the back of your throat. The 'sch' sounds like 's' followed by that soft 'g'.

content.title: Stating Your Profession
content.setting: You are at a party. Someone named Joost starts a conversation with you.

conversation_flow.title: Introduce yourself and ask what you do
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Hallo! Ik ben Joost. Wat doe jij?

conversation_flow.title: State your profession or what you study
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Interessant! En waar doe je dat?

extract_info.user_profession: Extract the user's profession or field of study

conversation_flow.title: Mention your company or university
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Oké. En vind je het leuk?

conversation_flow.title: Say if you like your work or study

content.text: Great! Now let's add some more detail. You can talk about your specific tasks and your working hours.
You can complete the phrase 'Ik doe dit al...' with a time period, for example: 'Ik doe dit al twee jaar' (I've been doing this for two years).

content.title: Describing Your Responsibilities
content.setting: The conversation continues. Joost asks for more details about your work or study.

conversation_flow.title: Ask about your tasks
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Wat is een taak die je doet?

conversation_flow.title: Describe one of your main tasks
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Oké. En werk je fulltime of parttime?

conversation_flow.title: State your working or study hours
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Duidelijk. En hoe lang doe je dit al?

conversation_flow.title: State how long you have been doing this

content.text: Excellent work. A good conversation is a two-way street. Now, let's learn how to ask Joost about his job.
To ask a yes/no question, the verb comes first. For example, 'Jij hebt' (You have) becomes 'Heb jij...?' (Do you have...?).

data.tip: The stress is on the second syllable: col-LE-ga's. The 'g' is soft, like in 'geschiedenis'.

content.title: Asking About Their Work
content.setting: You've talked about your work. Now it's your turn to ask Joost about his.

conversation_flow.title: Ask what Joost does for work
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ik ben leraar. Ik werk op een school.

conversation_flow.title: Ask if he has nice colleagues
Make a positive comment about his job
